title: Ping jumped 26ms for no reason.
body: I'm on Xfinity and I live in Alabama. For the longest time I had the basic package with xfinity. Which had like 25mbps or so. I got a steady 39ms which was nice. All of a sudden, one day my ping jumps up to 65ms. It never moves. It's always 65ms. So I even upgraded my connection to 100mpbs+ and I STILL get 65ms. Didn't move at all. What could be causing this? Playing on this ping feels like 150+ honestly. Very unplayable.

replies.body:
Your ISP or even upgrade may have changed how you're routing to the game server, maybe even taking a longer path to get here.  [Configuring your DNS ](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues)might help in this case. 

If not, a traceroute can get us an overview of any hiccups.  Download [WinMTR](http://winmtr.net/winmtr-v0-92-now-available/) and run a route to the game server: 104.160.131.1.  Run it for about 5 minutes, replace the IP address with dashes on the first two rows only, and let me know what you find.

Well I upgraded because of the bad connection and then it didn't change. So my guess is Xfinity changed something on their end down here cause my friend is on Xfinity and we had the exact same ping (39ms) and now we both have a steady 65ms-70ms

Ooof, that is starting off with some really bad ping before even leaving your own network.  When you upgraded , did they give you a new router?  

Something with your local network or settings is degrading your connection.  :(  Try each step of the [connection issues](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) guide to help rule out possibilities and get things tuned up.  That should get you fixed up, but let me know.
